attributes.action: Masks to be preferred not mandatory
attributes.additional_details:
The mandatory face covering rule conflicts with human rights. The protection of a few can never be at the cost of restrictions of normal life and function to the many. 

It also presents issues of not being able to clearly identify criminals, is a danger to the safety of children at risk of abduction and gives free reign without identification to person who wish to cause harm or break laws.
attributes.background: Remove the mandatory rule for face coverings in non medical places, including but not limited to schools, travel and shops.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Don't make the wearing of face masks compulsory in public places in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331174

Make the use of masks on public transport voluntary and not mandatory: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325079

Repeal the decision to implement compulsory face coverings in English shops: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331430

Do not make masks mandatory for children in primary or secondary schools in UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332497
